skill.name: finishing-a-development-branch
skill.description: Use when implementation is complete, all tests pass, and you need to decide how to integrate the work - guides completion of development work by presenting structured options for merge, PR, or cleanup
skill.summary: Use when implementation is complete, all tests pass, and you need to decide how to integrate the wor...
skill.author: davila7

security_audit.summary: This is a prompt-based skill containing only documentation and guidance instructions. No executable code, network calls, filesystem access, or environment variable reads are present. The skill provides workflow guidance to the AI agent for completing development branches safely.

content.value_statement: Developers often struggle with the final step of their workflow - deciding whether to merge, create a PR, or discard work. This skill provides a structured process to verify tests pass, present clear integration options, and safely execute the chosen workflow with proper confirmation safeguards.
actual_capabilities: Verify test suite passes before presenting integration options
Determine the correct base branch using git merge-base
Present four structured options: merge locally, create PR, keep branch, or discard
Execute chosen workflow with proper git commands and safety confirmations
Clean up git worktrees after completing work
Require explicit confirmation before discarding work
limitations: Does not automatically resolve merge conflicts - user must handle manually
Does not create or modify PR description templates beyond basic structure
Requires user to confirm the base branch before proceeding
Does not push to remote repositories without explicit user selection

use_cases.title: Feature branch completion
use_cases.description: Complete a feature branch and choose between merging locally or creating a pull request for team review

use_cases.title: Rapid iteration workflows
use_cases.description: Quickly test and discard experimental branches while maintaining a clean local repository

use_cases.title: Code review gatekeeping
use_cases.description: Enforce test verification before allowing code to proceed to merge or PR creation stages

prompt_templates.title: Basic feature completion
prompt_templates.scenario: Feature work is done and needs integration
prompt_templates.prompt: I've finished implementing the feature. Use the finishing-a-development-branch skill to help me complete this work.

prompt_templates.title: After task completion
prompt_templates.prompt: All tasks in the plan are complete. Help me finish up using the finishing-a-development-branch skill.

prompt_templates.title: Quick merge decision
prompt_templates.scenario: Need to merge without creating a PR
prompt_templates.prompt: I need to merge this branch directly into main locally. Guide me through the finishing-a-development-branch process.

prompt_templates.title: Experimental work cleanup
prompt_templates.prompt: This experiment did not work out. Help me safely discard this branch using the finishing-a-development-branch skill.

output_examples.input: I've finished implementing the feature. Use the finishing-a-development-branch skill to help me complete this work.
output: Implementation complete. What would you like to do?
2. Push and create a Pull Request
3. Keep the branch as-is (I'll handle it later)

best_practices: Always wait for tests to pass before presenting integration options
Require explicit confirmation before discarding any work
Clean up git worktrees only after successful completion
anti_patterns: Skipping test verification and proceeding with merge
Deleting branches without confirmation or backup

faq.question: Does this skill work with GitHub Enterprise or GitLab?
faq.answer: Yes. The PR creation commands use gh CLI which works with GitHub and GitHub Enterprise. For GitLab, use option 1 (merge locally) or manually create MRs.

faq.question: What happens if tests fail?
faq.answer: The skill stops and reports test failures. You must fix tests before proceeding. It will not offer merge/PR options with failing tests.

faq.question: Can I use this with trunk-based development?
faq.answer: Yes. Set the base branch to main or master as appropriate. The skill detects the base branch automatically using git merge-base.

faq.question: Is my work safe when discarding?
faq.answer: The skill requires typing 'discard' for confirmation. Worktree files remain until manually deleted. Consider pushing to a remote backup first.

faq.question: Does this skill modify remote branches?
faq.answer: Only option 2 (Push and Create PR) modifies remotes. All other options work locally with your explicit selection.

faq.question: How is this different from other git workflow skills?
faq.answer: This skill enforces test verification, provides structured options with safety guards, and handles worktree cleanup automatically after completion.
